personality.title: Luna
personality.look: A small, quiet woman sits behind the counter, intently working on a set of matched bolts. When she looks up at you, you see that she has a huge scar along the side of her face.
personality.name: "I am Luna," she says quietly.
personality.job: "I have missiles you can purchase. I also work for the rebels." When she speaks, she turns her face away from you, trying in vain to conceal the scar.

personality.title: Rita
personality.look: The woman looking after the bar is rather harried and not entirely sure what she's doing, but manages to do her job with such charm and good grace that nobody seems to mind.
personality.name: "Oh, hi hon! I'm Rita! How can I help?"
personality.job: "Oh, well, looking after the inn while Rudolph is gone. We have rations if you're going hiking somewhere. Whiskey is 4 gold, and a nice room is 10."

personality.title: Torri
personality.look: You meet a tired woman working doggedly to finish a spearhead. She's competent enough, but you can see her heart clearly isn't in it.
personality.name: "I am Torri the smith. Welcome to my shop."
personality.job: "We have weapons and armor you can purchase, and you can sell your excess goods to me as well. They're the highest quality goods, forged of our own mountain iron."

personality.title: Derfler
personality.look: Buzzard's an unusual town, and has an unusual trainer. He is a tall, imposing wizard, in full, traditional robes. He takes a break from instructing a captain in the finer details of woodcraft to speak with you.
personality.name: "I am Derfler. Welcome to the training hall."
personality.job: "I was a wizard of the Empire, now doing what is needed for the rebels. I can perform training of all sorts, and have been known to do identification as well."

personality.title: Stone
personality.look: This ragged man sits looking out over the pool. All of his worldly possessions are contained in two sacks at this side. A begging bowl sits in front of him.
personality.name: He grabs the bowl and holds it up to you. "I'm called Stone."
personality.job: "I'm just trying to get money for food. Spare a gold piece?"

personality.title: Machrone
personality.look: This man is sitting at his table, scribbling furiously on a vellum scroll. When you approach, however, he drops what he's doing to speak with you.
personality.name: "I am Machrone. Pleased to meet you!"
personality.job: He smiles and points at the scroll. "I'm an information gatherer."

personality.title: Smith
personality.look: You see a small, nondescript man, walking around town and thinking.
personality.name: He looks uncomfortable when you walk up to talk to him. "I'm Smith."

node.text: "Arrows, bolts, or crossbows?"
Luna's Arrows
Luna's Crossbows
Luna's Bolts
"You are to meet with the rebels. To get to them, press the button behind the plant." She points at the potted plant in the corner. "First, I'm to give you your next lesson in fighting the Empire."
She turns her face toward you and points at the scar on her cheek. "Jaen's men did this to me. The only thing I did for it was try to complain to Lord Volpe about conditions in the mines."
"The lesson is to never forget the evil of your enemies. I am reminded of it every day, and it keeps me strong. Others have their own reminders."

"Others have their own reminders. Dead mothers. Dead sons. If you are lucky enough to not have a reminder forced upon you, you must find your own. It's the only way you can stay strong. Now go. Stalker is waiting."
"Stalker is our leader. I would die for him." Her cold sincerity is inspiring and alarming at the same time.
Her cheery expression is temporarily marred by worry. "My husband. He normally runs the inn, but he's off fighting with the rebels."
She shakes her head. "Not something I wish to dwell on. How about a nice meal?"
She smiles patiently. "A room, whiskey, or a meal?"
Fine Rations
Rita takes a moment from her hard work to show you around back to your room. It's simple but comfortable, and you have a restful night.
She shakes her head. "Sorry, but the price is firm."
She serves you up a few shots of strong mountain liquor. The harsh liquid inflicts great pain and suffering on the inside of your mouth and throat, but in a good way.
You don't have the gold.
"Weapons, or armor?"
Torri's Weapons
Torri's Armor
She smiles wryly. "These mountains have all sorts of mines, with all sorts of valuable metals. My husband helped mine them. Once."
"My husband worked in the mines, until he went off to fight with the rebels. I sort of can understand it, considering the conditions. But I don't have to like it."

"Why do you think the rebellion started in these mountains? The mine workers were worked by Volpe's hand-picked lord for 16 hours a day, with terrible safety and minimal pay. Stalker was a miner once, until he fought back."
"This town's lord was the first to be punished."
She gives the spearhead an extra vicious blow with her hammer, and smiles. "His body will never be found."
He casts the difficult Identify spell with a minimum of effort, and looks over your items. "I can tell you what they are for a minimal fee. 12 gold each."
"The Empire sent me out with Lord Volpe years ago, to help maintain order. That was before I joined the rebels."
"A cruel, selfish, unjust man. He won't be missed."
"A wizard's mind travels in strange realms, but not so far off it loses sight of justice. Lord Volpe was treating this island unjustly, so I joined the rebels. I give knowledge, and fight as well."
"There is not a man or woman on this island who can throw a stronger fireball."

"Volpe placed me up here to settle unrest. He meant by this that I was supposed to fireball anyone who didn't follow his order. He treated me as a cog in his machine, ready to kill anyone who displeased him. So I left."
You give him a gold piece. "Thanks," he says. "Things haven't been going right since the mess in Fahl."
You don't have a gold piece.
"I was a woodsman down there. Then the rebels blew the town up, and I was out of work. I'm just waiting to get my job back."
"Ya' know, I suppose the rebels had their reasons for doing what they did, but I wish that they'd found another way. I want to be back to work."
"Just a nice, peaceful walk."
"Nothing can beat it."
"I know what you're thinking. I'm not a spy. I hail from the city of Krizsan. I work for a great new thing there. It's called a scroll of news."
"Beautiful city. Way to the south."
"It's a new sort of business, started by a wizard there. First, people like me are sent out to find out what is happening in the world."

"When we find something out, we use magic to communicate it back home, where they have a magical machine which makes lots of the scrolls, and they get sold to people. Then everyone can find out what is happening in Valorim!"
"Of course, I came here, because the rebellion is a great story."

"I don't know what the Empire will think of us telling people about this rebellion, but people will sure pay to read about it. That's why I came here. Of course, what I really want is to speak to Stalker."
"People barely tolerate my being here as it is. They certainly won't let me reach their secret leader to ask him questions. I would give anything for a few words."
"If you ever see him, mention my name! I can let people everywhere know what's happening! It could help him a lot! And it would sell us lots of scrolls. Everyone gains. Just think it over."
She looks over your items, and makes you an offer for everything identified.
